reviews.text: Rhotia Valley Tented Lodge is among the best tented camps I have been to in Africa. The views from the lodge are breathtaking and the service is wonderful. Unique furnishings add special touches and the landscape is spectacular! It's truly a beautiful hidden gem. GREAT place to stop at while en route to Ngorongoro Crater. Definitely take a 4WD as it's a steep and muddy drive to get there, but definitely worth it.
reviews.title: Wow- this place is a real retreat!

reviews.text: The children's home is immaculate. The children are so loving and appreciative. Marise is doing some amazing things in Karatu!! Thanks for a great time.
reviews.title: Most comfortable, welcoming, and inspirational place I stayed at

reviews.text: Great location on top of a hill, away from the main road and villages, right on the border of the Ngorongoro Conservation Area - the elephants walk around the camp at night - there is even a "bar" for them to drink at!
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely perfect and welcoming hosts who invited me to dine with them at their table, since I was traveling alone. I enjoyed their company very much!
reviews.title: True Africa

reviews.text: The tents are supremely comfortable (I loved the hot water bottle in bed at night!) with great views, the food is very good, and the service very genuine.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Scenic Lodge

likes.liked: — the quality of the tents and the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great property with real purpose about 40 minutes from the entrance to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. It's about 15 minutes down a dusty road off the main highway, set in the rolling hills of the rich Rhotia Valley farm communities. The lodges are literally 2-bedroom tents inside of bungalow frames. The inside of the tent is charming, cozy and clean, with piping hot showers, flush toilets and comfortable beds. My wife hates camping and loved this lodge for its charm and she couldn't get over how neat and clean it was. We were very happy with our decision to stay here.
reviews.title: Charming lodge nestled in farmland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note: the property is not that photogenic. Prior to our arrival we didn't love the looks of it but the price was right. After arriving, we couldn't have been more pleased with everything. The main lodge is the place to be. After freshening up each evening, we went up there for drinks, snacks, Scrabble, reading and the sunset before 7:30 dinner. Once the sun had set, we were brought a lantern for our table and some nice hot coals and blankets to keep us toasty (its quite chilly once the set sets at this elevation - nothing like the Serengeti). These are the details that made the property so wonderful.
reviews.title: A Special place with a purpose

reviews.text: Meals were very tasty. Most of the people seemed to be couples with the exception of a couple smaller groups. Only a few other people there when we stayed in Sept. 2011 - which was fine by us! This is a perfect little mix of rustic and luxury that truly serves the local community.
reviews.title: Pleasant Camp and Children's Home, pleasant experience

reviews.text: This is an outstanding tented camp and Lodge made even more worthwhile by the knowledge that the Dutch owners are putting all the profits into the excellent Children's Home that they have built across the valley. The setting is beautiful - high up and away from mosquitoes. The tents are superbly equipped with thoughtful touches that make a real difference to comfort with electricity in the evenings to the tent. The restaurant was excellent at both dinner and breakfast with nothing being too much trouble.Locally grown food and soon to be opened bakery provide further local skills development. Visitors should go and visit the Children's Home which George and Marisa also manage. The quality of care offered to the orphans, primarily from HIV/Aids, is of the highest quality and there has been a similar investment in the local primary and secondary schools. This is a model for how tourism can play a major part in development and the guest can feel that their visit is making a real difference.
reviews.title: Luxury camping!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in mid-August for only one night and it was a good experience. The camp and home are stituated in an farming area with beautiful views of red clay hills. Every night a group of elephants comes in for a drink out of their troughs. The camp is immaculate surrounded by well-tended gardens and grounds. The tents are small but comfortable with a roomy bathroom. I enjoyed watching the wide variety of birds that came by our veranda. We walked up and toured the children's home before dinner. We took some school supplies and they were graciously accepted. The home and school seemed very well designed and run. Some of the other guests played soccer with the kids of the home. The main lodge is attractive and our 8-yr-old loved playing with the resident kittens. The food was very good as was the service. The Dutch couple (both retired doctors) who built and run the camp are friendly and very interesting to talk to. Our older daughter wasn't feeling well and they gave us some valuable advice.
reviews.title: Loved it-so cozy!

reviews.text: We were extremely lucky to stay twice at this lodge in our trip throughout Tanzania. Given its good location not far from Karatu, it's an ideal place close to Lake Manyara, Ngorongoro Crater and Lake Easy. We enjoyed the warm welcome from Joris & Marise and their story of the Children's Home and Lodge. The visit to the Children's Home was an eye-opener for us and our kids. But the splendid location on the hils with views up to Lake Manyara, the great vegetable garden, the charming tents with bed heating (!) and terrace (complementary view), the great food, the perfect & personel service, etc... make this one of the best lodges we have visited so far. Do take some time to relax here for a half day as the surrounding, the Children's Home, the lodge phylophosy and the service is worthed doing so. This is a luxury place that gives you a warm & good feeling inside.
reviews.title: Perfect feel good place with a story

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can onkly agree with the other reviews here. The whole layout of teh place is charming, they have there own allotment gardens here which looked lovely as well. The tents are comfortable and quite luxurious, we had a hot water bottle in bed every evening put on for us while at lunch and a turn down service. Balconies overlook the valley. Lodge is quite high up and cool at night. There is a loveky lounge with roaring fire and a nice bar area. Cant complain about anything here. Highly recommended
reviews.title: Best place stayed in

reviews.text: I was here for two nights in early February 2011. There is a new manager who took over a few months ago and who is working to improve what was already a good thing. She was quite friendly and was very interested if all our needs were being met and to get our feedback. So, when you read older reviews, keep this in mind.
reviews.title: Best service I have ever received and in spectacular location

reviews.text: I have travelled a lot in North America, Europe and the Middle East, often for work and often staying at expensive hotels. The service I received at Rhotia beat them all hands down. Every need and want was anticipated and with a level personal service that I have never seen before. I really felt like I had been mistaken for a top celebrity of some sort.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Contrary to what some others have said, we both found the food portions to be more than adequate; at one point I joked that we were getting American sized portions. The food was also very tasty including the box lunches.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem up a hidden valley.
